subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Alan Trammell, fired last year as the manager of the Detroit Tigers, was hired yesterday as the Chicago Cubs’ bench coach for Lou Piniella. Trammell, a six-time All-Star shortstop during his playing career with the Tigers, agreed to a two-year deal. Piniella, hired a week ago, had already retained the pitching coach Larry Rothschild. As the Detroit manager from 2003-5, Trammell, 48, compiled a 186-300 record, including a 43-119 record his first season. He was also the first-base coach for the San Diego Padres from 2000-2.
